questions.question_text: Which of the following is used to classify network data for the purpose of providing QoS?

discussion.content:
DSCP is correct. The differentiated services code point is a 6-bit entry in an 8-bit differentiated services field in an IP header. This is used to classify data and help manage QoS in a network.
STP is incorrect; Spanning Tree Protocol is used to provide loop avoidance.
VLANs is incorrect; Virtual LANs classify and break up a network into distinct broadcast domains but do not classify the data.
SIP is incorrect; Session Initiation Protocol is used to construct and deconstruct multimedia sessions.

The correct answer is D.
Quality of Service (QoS) DSCP Marking is used to determine traffic classification for network data. This can be used to determine which network traffic requires higher bandwidth, has a higher priority, and more likely to drop packets.

More information:
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/support/docs/quality-of-service-qos/qos-packet-marking/10103-dscpvalues.html
https://packetpushers.net/how-does-qos-work/
https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/207368756-QoS-DSCP-Marking

Differentiated services or DiffServ is a computer networking architecture that specifies a simple and scalable mechanism for classifying and managing network traffic and providing quality of service on modern IP networks. Differentiated services or DiffServ is a computer networking architecture that specifies a simple and scalable mechanism for classifying and managing network traffic and providing quality of service on modern IP networks.
The given answer is correct because QoS is associated with DiffServ, which is related to DSCP.

questions.question_text: A local firm has hired a consulting company to clean up its IT infrastructure. The consulting company notices remote printing is accomplished by port forwarding via publicly accessible IPs through the firm's firewall. Which of the following would be the MOST appropriate way to enable secure, remote printing?

discussion.content: this should be ssh. Hint: port forwarding

questions.question_text:
A technician recently installed a new home router for a customer. The WiFi password was only applied to devices that were locked down with parental controls.
The day after the installation, the customer reported the connection had become slow. The technician reviewed the logs, which indicated a large influx of video streaming. After the customer changed the WiFi password, the streaming stopped, and the performance returned to normal. However, later that night, the same connection slowdown occurred. Which of the following should the technician recommend to the customer to fix this issue? (Choose two.)

discussion.content: How can one of the answers be B) when the question already states that they've changed the Wifi password?

comments.content: Ah they mean the SSID password not the firmware of the Router, my bad.

questions.question_text: Which of the following needs to be configured on a Layer 2 interface to allow multiple VLANs to pass through?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
The technology that allows traffic to be sent through two different ISPs to increase performance is:

C. Load balancing

Load balancing distributes network traffic across multiple paths, which can include different ISPs, to optimize resource use, maximize throughput, and minimize response time. It can also provide redundancy in case one of the paths fails.

A. Fault tolerance is primarily concerned with ensuring system availability and reliability in the event of failures, but it does not specifically address distributing traffic for performance improvement.
B. Quality of service (QoS) involves prioritizing certain types of traffic to ensure the performance of critical applications, but it does not inherently involve using multiple ISPs to increase performance.
D. Port aggregation (or link aggregation) combines multiple network connections into a single logical link to increase bandwidth and provide redundancy, but it typically involves multiple connections to the same network rather than different ISPs.
